quotes.text: My mom used to say today is a great day for a great day.
quotes.author:
Angela Lopez
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: Get that woman out of your house.
quotes.author:
Wade Grey
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: I thought Charlie was a guy.
quotes.author:
Angela Lopez
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: I love Rookie Day. It’s Christmas and the Purge in one.
quotes.author:
Timothy Bradford
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: Don’t make me pull the "buried alive" card.
quotes.author:
Lucy Chen
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: The only way to show you I'm a good cop is to show you I'm a good cop.
quotes.author:
Angela Lopez
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: I would shut that down so fast.
quotes.author:
Celina Juarez
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: In my mind, I'm hitting you right now.
quotes.author:
Lucy Chen
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: Nothing like a traumatic event to make you realize that your life is empty.
quotes.author:
Pam
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: I just found out this morning that Bailey has been dead more than once.
quotes.author:
John Nolan
From "The Rookie"

quotes.text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
quotes.author: Edward V Berard

quotes.text: Computer science education cannot make anybody an expert programmer any more than studying brushes and pigment can make somebody an expert painter.
quotes.author: Eric S. Raymond

quotes.text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: In God we trust. All others must bring data.
quotes.author: W. Edwards Demming

quotes.text: In theory, theory and practice are the same. In practice, they’re not.
quotes.author: Yoggi Berra

quotes.text: You can’t have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
quotes.author: Jim McCarthy

quotes.text: The best programmers are not marginally better than merely good ones. They are an order-of-magnitude better, measured by whatever standard: conceptual creativity, speed, ingenuity of design, or problem-solving ability.
quotes.author: Randall E. Stross

quotes.text: People think that computer science is the art of geniuses but the actual reality is the opposite, just many people doing things that build on each other, like a wall of mini stones.
quotes.author: Donald Knuth

quotes.text: Most of you are familiar with the virtues of a programmer. There are three, of course: laziness, impatience, and hubris.
quotes.author: Larry Wall

quotes.text: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
quotes.author: Martin Golding

quotes.text: Nine people can’t make a baby in a month.
quotes.author: Fred Brooks

quotes.text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
quotes.author: Martin Fowler

quotes.text: Programming is like sex. One mistake and you have to support it for the rest of your life.
quotes.author: Michael Sinz

quotes.text: If builders built buildings the way programmers wrote programs, then the first woodpecker that came along would destroy civilization.
quotes.author: Gerald Weinberg

quotes.text: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.
quotes.author: Brian W. Kernighan

quotes.text: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think "I know, I'll use regular expressions." Now they have two problems.
quotes.author: Jamie Zawinski

quotes.text: You can use an eraser on the drafting table or a sledgehammer on the construction site
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.text: The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.
quotes.author: Tom Cargill

quotes.text: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.
quotes.author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quotes.text: It's all talk until the code runs.
quotes.author: Ward Cunningham

quotes.text: Given enough eyeballs, all bugs are shallow.
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Being a good software engineer is 3% talent, 97% not being distracted by the internet.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.text: A ship in port is safe, but that's not what ships are built for.
quotes.author: Grace Hopper

quotes.text: The imposter syndrome is real. Luckily, it goes away.
quotes.author: Kimber Lockhart

quotes.text: Know how to learn. Then, want to learn.
quotes.author: Katherine Johnson

quotes.text: Never trust a computer you can’t throw out a window.
quotes.author: Steve Wozniak

quotes.text: When in doubt, use brute force.
quotes.author: Ken Thompson

quotes.text: Once a new technology starts rolling, if you’re not part of the steamroller, you’re part of the road.
quotes.author: Stewart Brand

quotes.text: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.text: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming. Feedback is the treatment.
quotes.author: Kent Beck

quotes.text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
quotes.author: Grady Booch

quotes.text: I'm not a great programmer. I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
quotes.author: Kent Beck
